intro: Harpalyce parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered harpalyce, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Harpalyce parvifolia is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
